comments:
I dont know if this is a CDT bug or an eclipse 3.1 bug, or if i have chosen the
right component

I just installed Eclipse 3.1 and CDT 3.0 M7, everything works fine, but if i
install any other plug-in (well, i only installed the Eclipse UML2 and EMF
plug-ins, then E.P.I.C. Perl plug-in) CDT gets disabled.

First I installed EMF and UML2 then restarted the workbench. I got an error
about being unable to restore workbench and it defaults back to the resource
browsing perspective. CDT perspective is not available, CDT does not show up in
the plug-ins list from help>about eclipse>plug-in details. The org.eclipse.cdt*
directories are there, but just not registering. The only fix i have found is a
full re-install of eclipse and the cdt plug-in.

I decided to try and install E.P.I.C. Perl plugin, and the same problem occured.

Here is the dump of my error log on the start up after installing the E.P.I.C.
plug-in:

 !SESSION 2005-06-29 11:42:19.261 -----------------------------------------------

java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86
